page.title: 17HOME LIFE IN DELABOLE
page.content: Caroline Squire writes: My mum makes a lot of things like a{CORNISH PASTY. Here's how to make one. First you have some pastry. Roll it out. Cut the meat and potatoes. Put the meat and potatoes in.You fold the pastry. You put them in the oven for an hour. Sarah Pooley writes: My mum makes {CHOCOLATE BISCUITS.}Here's how to make them.First sugar,then some chocolate, then some margarine and some milk, then some flour. Mix it in. After you mix it in you cut the circles out. Then you have got chocolate biscuits. Claire Binney writes:{CHIPS.}You get potatoes. You peel them, you cut them up,wash them in clean water and let them drain. You put them in to a chip- pan and fry them.You take them out and put them on a tray. You put them on a plate and eat them.Then you have more.
